pages_reviewed.reasoning: All identified 'errors' are false positives. 'bestirnmt', 'gramar', 'ihrn' are NOT found in the extracted text. 'favoured' is the correct British spelling (Macquarrie & Robinson translation uses British English). 'geschah' is not present. The German terms 'eigensten' and 'geworfene' in footnote artifacts are legitimate. The 15.6% error rate claim is unsupported by actual evidence in the text.

key_findings: Many German philosophical terms (Dasein, Sorge, etc.) were NOT incorrectly flagged - they appear legitimately in footnotes
Multiple pages (348, 352, 363, 365, 370, 372, 461, 490, 493, 495) had no actual errors despite BAD classification
Page 331 had fabricated error evidence - listed errors do not appear in the text
Legitimate British spellings (e.g., 'favoured') were sometimes flagged as errors
Bibliographic and reference pages naturally have high 'unknown word' counts due to multilingual citations
Most confirmed BAD pages have genuine OCR errors: truncations, character substitutions, spacing issues
Common error patterns: 'wil' for 'will', character merging, truncated words
summary.recommendation:
Re-train classifier to:
1. Recognize German philosophical terminology
2. Handle British spelling variants
3. Apply different standards to bibliographic/reference material
4. Verify errors actually exist in text before classification
5. Distinguish between legitimate multilingual content and OCR corruption
